intro: Skeptrostachys congestiflora, commonly known as the clustered spikeflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments.
